data.title: Very salty food in a dangerously loud environment
data.text:
Tried this food togo for the first time in thirty years. Things are not any better. They dropped the weck and just add too much salt now. My wife and I had sw steak sandwich, so salty we could barely eat. My son's wings were sickly sweet for the bbq and inedibly hot for the basic hot flavor

Never coming back

data.title: Good wings but not consistant.
data.text: Went there twice in one week around 1:30 or 2.  The first time (and my first ever) I ordered the Asian Zing traditional wings. Not too impressed. Actually soggy or under cooked and it took about 45 minutes for a snack sized order, table of one. Second time I sat at the bar and I ordered snack size traditional Garlic Parmesan. My order arrived so quickly I was surprised. I actually brought something to read to pass the time and had not even opened the book.  This time the wings were nice and crispy and loved the sauce.  A bit loud with all the TVs AND music playing overhead.

data.title: Good food but noisy
data.text: Food is good, but not a place to go if you want to carry on a conversation with your companions.  Very noisy with TVs going and especially noisy when a sports event is going on with yelling.  You cannot hear yourself think1

data.title: Really bad!!!
data.text: I was there with my family last night,  the waiting time to be seated was 1 hour due to the UFC fight, anyway we decided to wait. But when finaly we had a table, the server (Savanah ) came with a really bad attitude, and took our order, all my family ordered fountain drinks and my husband ordered a beer. She came with the drinks, but never with the beer, when my husband asked her for the beer, she got mad. After 40 min we did the order, the food was on the table, but guess what?....The food was cold, and my son's wings was undercooked,  of course, I asked to talk to the manager. He came to talk to us, and offered a big plate of wings as part of an apologize, but we didn't accept,  because if we decided to wait a whole hour, was because we wanted a good service and quality of the food,  not to get something for free!!!

data.title: Good food, but poorly run
data.text: The few times I've been to this particular Buffalo Wild Wings there is always a considerable wait to be seated and for food despite there seeming to be just as many employees as there are diners.  This is one of the small Bdubs I've been to in a particularly busy part of town which doesn't help them.  The food is good though once you do get it but just allow extra time when you go out.  Staff is also really friendly.

data.title: Fun place
data.text: Lots of screens for sports fans. Great wings and boneless chicken, with some great sauces. Try the Blazin Jalapeño with the the chicken "spun" in medium. Great choices of draft beer, and the service was very good. Nice place

data.title: Comically bad service, atrocious food
data.text:
I like Buffalo Wild Wings and have reviewed other locations positively - this is a knock of this specific location, not the company itself. 

This was, bar none, the worst lunch experience I've had in many years. In my adult life, I've stiffed a server three times - today was the third. If I'm going to say something bad about a place, I usually sleep on it, but the whole experience was so bizarre it sent me into in existential contemplation about the nature of the following query: which was worse, the service or the food? The answer: yes. 

I arrived at high noon, and although I've eaten in maybe 50 BWWs over the years, this was the first that didn't have a greeter, and it had an empty barroom even though it's in an NFL town with a football game tonight. I should have left right then, but I stayed. The bartender was covering the bar floor as well and I asked where I could sit and she said anywhere I wanted. She had four customers at the bar, and 2-3 tables. After about 5 minutes give/take, she brought me a menu and asked for my drink order. I told her I wanted tea and an order of onion rings to start. 

The rings took awhile to get out and they were lukewarm - no silverware, no napkins. In fairness, she realized a few minutes later that I had no silverware or napkins and brought me two glorious napkins, no silverware. Whatever, I was starving, so I ate them and said nothing, and my tea was now empty. My co-worker joined me around 12:15 and he sat until nearly 12:25 before she came over. He ordered wings, and I ordered a burger/fries side of mayo, and I asked for a fresh tea - she brought me a fresh glass of tea and left the dirty one on the table. To say she was mailing it in would be an insult to the US Postal Service - I kept waiting for Gordon Ramsey to come out of the kitchen and start screaming at her, just to see if it might liven her up a bit. I've never seen a human being wait tables as though they'd broken parole and this was their court-ordered punishment.  

Anyway: For the next half hour, we waited. 

Neither of us were in a hurry and we talked business. After about 20 minutes, though, we both noticed that it sure was taking a long time to get our food, especially in a restaurant that was dead. "She's probably out back smoking a cigarette and texting," my co-worker said, and it was clear the server had disappeared. We both realized we were suddenly trapped in the middle of a really bad ripoff of a Samuel Beckett play.

It was somewhere around 1 when our "food" came out. His wings were cold but he was hungry so he ate them. "Your burger sure looks dry," he said, and as I applied mayo to the cold, stale bun, I put my finger on the patty and realized it was somewhere between room temperature and what we in the civilized world would call "luke warm." I took one bite and spit it out in my napkin. The server returned with silverware and I told her she could take my cold burger. She didn't ask what was wrong, she didn't apologize, nothing. She had all the curiosity of a burro who doesn't feel like moving. 

She took the burger back to the kitchen and whence cometh a manager - unsure if it was the kitchen manager, the manager on duty or the store manager or just someone pretending to work at this location, as she didn't bother to introduce herself. She asked why I sent the burger back and I said "It's old and stale and has obviously been sitting under a heatlamp for some time." She didn't apologize, but she did make sure and say "It wasn't sittting there that long" at which point I cut her off and told her I wasn't here to debate the matter. She asked if I wanted another burger and I said no. She still didn't apologize for the crap product that her crap kitchen produced. Miraculously, they took the burger off my ticket. 

We hung out for awhile because our server wouldn't bring the check over. Even after we asked for the check, she made sure and tended to every one of her bar customers - all 5 of them at this point - before finally printing our checks. My friend tipped a dollar, and I tipped a big fat donut. 

I'm Tweeting this review to Buffalo Wild Wings because I want them to read through all the reviews I've done here and notice how few of them have anything bad to say about the places I eat and sleep. I'm a happy, positive traveler and if I can convince BWW to either close that facility or clean house, then I consider it a favor to an otherwise good company and all the people who wonder whether or not they should eat at this depressing landfill. 

In closing: two years ago in Utila Bay, Honduras, I ate a bad bowl of stew, vomited for a couple of hours and slept in a cold sweat for about six more. I was on an island in a third-world country with limited medical care. I would rather eat at that place again than this Buffalo Wild Wings. 

FIN

data.title: Not going again
data.text: I had stopped going here months ago because the quality of the food got bad, especially the wings.  But my Granddaughter wanted to go, so we went.   I ordered Extra Crispy Wings - and after a long weight, they came out not at all crispy.   I sent them back and was told it would take a long time to start a new order.  Within 5 minutes the manager came out with perfect Extra Crispy wings.  15 minutes later the waitress came out with my "new" order (not even realizing the manager brought mine already) and she said THESE ARE REALLY CRISPY.  Guess what.  THEY WERE NOT.  Aside from that, they now charge for every little thing you order, including celery.  REALLY?  Not worth the hassle.

data.title: What is happening?
data.text: We have eaten here for the Tuesday special probably 40 times and each time has been great except the last couple of times. We have always said that maybe the server was having an off night or the cook was too. This time the food was ok and so was the service. It started off with the fact that they switched to Pepsi products, which Coke drinkers HATE. I also hate when you say a Diet Coke they bring a Diet Pepsi instead thinking you won't notice. The drinks were a problem from the beginning and the kids drinks need more carbonation. The wings were ok with little sauce. Had to ask to bring us the ranch and blue cheese we ordered twice. Overall, I think the service and food quality continues to decline and this was probably our last time here.

data.title: Great Place
data.text: Food was great and the service was better. The food came out very quickly and was very good. The servers were very polite and there to get whatever you needed. The queso is also very good.

data.title: Wings!!!!
data.text: We went Wednesday for dinner and i understand is always full there and very loud which i don't mine. The server was very nice. Food was good. the wings were kinda dry, overall i love eating there.

data.title: Great B-dubs!
data.text: We took a group of 9 for lunch on Sunday and could not be more pleased with the service and food.  We were seated promptly and the hostess went out of her way to find the Cleveland Indians game on the large screen by our table so we could catch our home town team's game.  What a luxury to catch a Tribe game 1400 miles from home.  The place was immaculately clean and the food was hot and delicious, just like our B-Dubs back home.

data.title: Good Wings
data.text: Cold beer and crispy wings. Sauce could have been a tad bit spicier although I did order the Carribean Jerk

data.title: Great place for adults and children
data.text:
I never really wanted to go to this place with my kuds because it was a bar and grill and thought it would be a more of a bar atmosphere. It wasn't until I noticed families going in that convinced me to try it.
When we walked in it felt very comfortable. Sometimes having kids come along to what you think is an adult only atmosphere can feel a little uncomfortable but this wasn't the case. Sure, there were plenty of adults watching games play out on tv but there were many families there too. Some of the families with the parents watching the game and kids playing the portable touch screen games. Yes, they not only have arcade machines but also portable touch screen game tablets. The tablets are big like a small flat screen television that stands. You need a credit card to add funds and although most of the games are more for adults to play together while having a few drinks and wings there are a few kid games. 
It was clean and a good kind of noisy. The kind of noise you expect to hear at a large family gathering where everyone is having a great time. This was perfect for the kids who can almost always have their parents saying "shhh" when having dinner but also great fir the adults having a conversation and not feel that everyone is listening in.
The restrooms were very clean and staff very nice even if they weren't serving you.
I loved this place! The prices are what you would expect to spend going out to eat. 
Bottom line this is a place where everyone can have a great time from the single people to families.

data.title: Great Service and great food.
data.text: I went here with a friend for lunch and the flat bread pizza was great. The service was great and our waitress was friendly and always smiling trying to convince me to move to Colorado! We had the fried cheese cake balls with chocolate and caramel dipping sauce and they were fantastic. Looks like it would be a great place to watch a game although I didn't have the pleasure of doing that.

data.title: If you want wings this is your place
data.text: They've got a bunch of variety as far as wings go, and the place was friendly and well lit and clean. So if you want wings, you'll be happy here. Caution, even the hot wings are hot, so you don't need to go warmer than that (they have two flavors hotter and I didn't go there).  Just my $.02.   ;-)

data.title: Sunday NFL
data.text: Crowded as heck, but the manager was amazing at getting us a table and getting the TV in front of us to the right game. Prepare for a good 40 minute wait on game days, and the food is priced well for the quality. I recommend chicken ranch wrap. Yum!

data.title: B-Dubs!
data.text: B-Dubs!

data.title: Bdubs!  When I was preggo my poor baby was on fire inside while i ate all the hot sauces!
data.text: Bdubs!  When I was preggo my poor baby was on fire inside while i ate all the hot sauces!

data.title: The best wings....ever!!
data.text: The best wings....ever!!
